label: 戸
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: a residence unit, and the object of the ritsuryô census-taking and taxation processes. According to the ritsuryô, residence-unit registers (koseki 戸籍) charting the familial relations of residents and their tax status were to be maintained by the residence-unit head (kochô 戸長) in cooperation with township heads (gôji 郷司) and district chieftains (gunji). Some such registers from the late seventh through ninth centuries are extant. [律令] [郡司]
